comments.content:
The project management plan contains the project management baseline data (typically cost, schedule, and scope), which you'll use to monitor and compare performance measurements against. Typically you'll establish performance metrics when developing the plan and then measure them once the work of the project has started.

A key performance indicator (KPI) is a measurable value that shows whether the project is reaching its intended goals. KPIs should be measurable and applicable to the project.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I believe KPI is the best answer. It is normally included in a dashboard where a few clicks can provide you with data on if the project is within scope or not.
Baselines should be the answer. The key word here is "against". Baselines are the original data that any variables are measured against.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important component against which the project manager can analyze project performance?

Gas prices were included in the cost baseline for a transportation and hauling project. Although the estimates used to create the baseline were based on historical data, which of the following should the project manager consider as a root cause for potential issues with cost overruns?

discussion.content: D. Environment. It is the only thing that historical data cannot account for accurately.

D. Environment. Which is external and encompasses external factors that could affect the project. Think about a Cause&Effect/fishbone chart/ishikawa diagram. Which can find the root cause of an issue... And ask yourself if budget is considered a root cause to your problems... Sounds like bad planning and estimating from the sponsor at the beginning of the project. D Environment is the only variable that could be considered a root cause.

questions.question_text: While preparing to plan a project, the project manager meets with the key stakeholders to determine the flexibility between the project constraints. Which of the following techniques should the project manager consider to reduce personal bias and increase buy-in?

choices.C: Compare the constraints two at a time and have the stakeholders vote on importance
choices.A: Send the stakeholders a survey about the project constraints to complete anonymously
choices.D: Look at historical information regarding the flexibility preferences of key stakeholders
choices.B: Watch and determine which constraint is most important

discussion.content: Wouldnt project sponsor, C. Be the better option here? because the sponsor has a high level of authority in general over the project.

Selected Answer: C
The project sponsor and sometimes a project manager can approve changes.
Sponsor handles conflicts that could hinder the completion of the project. Senior management, handles business disputes. Team isn't relevant
This is really misleading since the wording in the question is "authority"
